title: How to Make a Wrestling Ring in Minecraft Xbox 360 Edition

steps.headline: Gather your materials.
steps.description:
You will need:
Wool (any colour)
Fence
Coal block
Block of your choice for the apron
Another block of your choice for the ring mat

steps.headline: Decide on the size.
steps.description: Choose how big you want your ring to be and make your apron (outline of the ring) with your block of choice. About 10-5 on each side is good. Keep it 1 block high.

steps.headline: Fill in the inside of your apron (outline of the ring) with the block you chose.
steps.description: A good choice might be quartz, but it's up to you. If you have room you can put in a letter like R for Raw

steps.headline: In each corner, place a 2 block high post with a coal block.
steps.description: If you used coal block for the apron or ring mat, change the post colour for a better look.

steps.headline: On the highest block of your ring post, put your wool from that side to the post next to it.
steps.description: This makes the ropes for your ring

steps.headline: Go to each corner with your ladders and with the 2 pieces of wool that are connected to the pole, put ladders on them.
steps.description: Do this on every corner, inside and out. This gives access to the ring and the top rope

steps.headline: Decorate around it.
steps.description: You might like to add an entrance with fireworks or an announcers table with some commentators.

text:
Gather your materials. You will need:
Wool (any colour)
Fence
Coal block
Block of your choice for the apron
Another block of your choice for the ring mat Decide on the size. Choose how big you want your ring to be and make your apron (outline of the ring) with your block of choice. About 10-5 on each side is good. Keep it 1 block high. Fill in the inside of your apron (outline of the ring) with the block you chose. A good choice might be quartz, but it's up to you. If you have room you can put in a letter like R for Raw In each corner, place a 2 block high post with a coal block. If you used coal block for the apron or ring mat, change the post colour for a better look. On the highest block of your ring post, put your wool from that side to the post next to it. This makes the ropes for your ring Go to each corner with your ladders and with the 2 pieces of wool that are connected to the pole, put ladders on them. Do this on every corner, inside and out. This gives access to the ring and the top rope Decorate around it. You might like to add an entrance with fireworks or an announcers table with some commentators.
